text:
Hi

I feel the documentations on <http://developers.HubSpot.com|developers.HubSpot.com> seriously needs to be looked at.

This is suppose to serve as the bible for all HubSpot developers, especially the newcomers.

Every single tutorial video on HubSpot academy also advises to refer to the documents from this portal.

Yet this portal has just become a maze… and its filled with so many dead links, which otherwise, are suppose to contain important references and guidelines for development using hubl

One of the examples: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields/empathy#spacing>

Was just trying to find some documentation to understand module style fields better… ended up here. There are countless more links like this.

This is a going to be huge problem for the HubSpot developer community if not looked into

<@U2H3TT8F2> <@U7SL518D6>
i need build HubSpot app for message and calling between HubSpot and my own app

Hi <@UMWRTGBMZ>, thank you for bringing this to our attention. Where was the above module theme fields link from? I can make loop in with some users internally to get that updated.

Style fields information would be here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields-overview#style-fields>
Does anyone have a strategy for tracking simple visits to a page in HubSpot when cookies are disabled/disallowed? Something like an old school counter?
Just circling up that I updated the links on that page. Thank you again for calling this out <@UMWRTGBMZ>
All field types should link to the proper docs now :slightly_smiling_face:

*Attention HubSpot developers!!*

An affiliate company just asked if we can take on a super urgent HubSpot website project, but unfortunately, we don't have the capacity to do so at the moment.

Is anyone able to take on a 10-page website project with 2 of the pages due immediately? Below is a very rough summary of the project along with contact information if you are interested in taking this on.

> *Agency Seeking a HubSpot Developer for a high-priority and time-sensitive project. Starts Immediately.*
> Develop a website using a previous HubSpot account with multiple domains under that account. Site is *NOT* hard-coded, and needs to be easily editable/user friendly. At the end of the process this website should have an URL and subdomain.
> Our client would like the following for their website:
> • Development Up to 10 pages
> • User friendly website that is not hard-coded
> • QA before final delivery
> • Site should be mobile optimized
> • We will need regular updates from you on the development progress
> Can you provide us with the following:
> 1. A budget estimate
> 2. Is the urgent timeline doable?
> *Priority Dates:*
> **Homepage Due Wednesday June 8th*
> **2 additional pages due Friday June 10th*
> 
> If available, please reach out to <mailto:brooke@itscreativejuice.com|brooke@itscreativejuice.com>

Thanks <@U2H3TT8F2> for sorting this out

However, this is just one instance that I came across yesterday…  there other pages too which have dead links like this one.

If I come across any other, I’ll surely notify here, but if possible, all the docs on <http://developers.HubSpot.com/> should be inspected by your respective team

Can anyone help ?
We can't leave our system vulnerable.
